products.title: Meghmalhar Gift Hamper
products.body_html:
Celebrate the festive season with a gift that’s generous, flavourful, and thoughtfully crafted. A complete coffee experience for those who love their rituals.

This hamper includes:
- A healthy, crunchy blend of nuts and dried fruits (50 grams)
- A sleek Bullet French Press for home brewing (450 ml)
- A medium roast coffee blend with fruity overtones (250 grams, French Press Grind)
- Suchali’s Artisan Bakehouse’s hearty and buttery oatmeal & cranberry cookies (10 pieces)
- Crunchy Orange Almond Biscotti (6 pieces)
- A refreshing, ready-to-drink coffee in a can (250ml)
- Suchali’s Artisan Bakehouse's handcrafted Lavash for savoury snacking (150 grams)
- Portable Drip Bags for fuss-free brewing (20 bags)
- A charming Nilgiri Tumbler for sipping in style (1 unit)

products.title: Silver Oak Cafe Blend 75g
products.body_html: If our baristas have brewed you an espresso-based drink at any of our coffee shops, you’ll be familiar with this special offering since it’s our signature house blend! Our Silver Oak Cafe blend features a combination of Ground coffee beans, processed using either the washed or the unwashed method, to create and has a balanced profile that works well in espresso-based drinks as well as in manual brews such as AeroPress, Pour Over or in cold brews. This versatile medium roast is named after the Silver Oak trees commonly found across coffee plantations in Southern India. This offering is a small way of bringing our cafe experience to you.

products.title: Kolli Berri Estate
products.body_html:
Our first coffee from Harvest ‘24 is a medium-dark roast with chocolatey and nutty flavours. This single-origin ground coffee hails from the beautiful Kolli Berri Estate, set in Chikmagalur, Karnataka.

While brewing this one, you’ll notice the unique characteristics of the coffee beans, starting with the aroma of dried fruits, followed by a syrupy mouthfeel in every sip. With medium acidity and medium- high bitterness, it offers a full-bodied profile which is enhanced when brewed as an espresso or using an AeroPress, Moka Pot or a French Press.

products.title: A Peek into The World of Specialty Coffee | Roastery Tour
products.body_html:
Ever wondered how your favourite Arabica specialty coffees are sourced and roasted? How does one differentiate a light, medium or dark roast? Join us for an exclusive roastery tour to know about the basics of roasting coffee and how we source India’s highest-scoring coffees.

Soak in the aroma of freshly roasted coffee as you deep dive into our relationship with partner farms, the types of coffees we source, why we choose specific samples and much more. But the fun doesn’t just end there! Witness live sample roasting to see green beans turn into roasted beans!

Transparency is at the core of everything we do. So, we welcome you to ask us anything during our coffee workshop, and we’ll be happy to share our insights with you.

Date: 27th September 2025
Timings: 12 PM - 2 PM
Venue:
Bangalore - Blue Tokai Roastery, Seetharampalya

Please note

  • Wear covered shoes for the event. No strong cologne or perfume should be applied as they may impact the aromas of the coffee beans.
  • Tickets are non-refundable and you cannot transfer your ticket to a future event.

products.title: Matcha Brewing Workshop
products.body_html:
Join us for a refreshing afternoon of matcha mastery at Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters.

In collaboration with Got Tea, this immersive Matcha Brewing Workshop will guide you through the art of brewing ceremonial-grade matcha, exploring matcha styles, pairings, and techniques. Whether you're new to matcha or a long-time fan, this hands-on session is designed to deepen your love for this vibrant green tea.

What’s Included:

  • Expert-led session covering traditional brewing methods (Usucha & Koicha)
  • Guided tastings of matcha grades and regional variations
  • Learn to craft three creative modern matcha beverages
  • Printed Matcha Booklet to take home
  • Limited group size for a more focused experience

Date: 20th September 2025 (Saturday)
Time: 11 AM - 1 PM
Location: Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters, Maker Maxity

Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters, Panchsheel

Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters, AECS Layout

Don’t miss this unique celebration of matcha, tea culture, and craftsmanship.

Please Note: Tickets for this event are non-refundable and cannot be transferred to future events.

products.title: Riverdale Estate - Gesha Natural
products.body_html:
A decade ago, Prakashan from Riverdale Estate planted Gesha, one of the world’s rarest coffee varietals, on his farm in Yercaud. In 2023, after eight years of care, came Riverdale’s first Gesha harvest—one that we roasted as part of our debut Nano-X lineup. Since then, this rare varietal has become a core part of our Nano-X, a limited-edition series featuring experimental lots, crafted by a handful of producers and creative Blue Tokai roasters.

This year’s produce, as Prakashan puts it, is the best so far. The plants have matured and come into their own. The processing has become more and more refined over harvests. And thanks to Subham’s seasoned hands, the same goes for our roasting.

The lot we sourced was processed using the carbonic maceration method. Ripe, high-density cherries were placed in purpose-built drums. Using special valves, the drums were made oxygen-free and CO2 rich. This controlled fermentation pushed the Gesha’s already exceptional character and complexity further. Slow, controlled drying helped lock in these developments.

Given the high density of the beans and their delicate aromatics, this Gesha was a worthy challenge for Subham. Drawing on both experience and a bit of experimentation, he added airflow during the development phase of roasting by opening the hopper chute. This reduced the heavy caramelisation that usually builds at this stage, creating an air-roaster-like profile and unlocking striking clarity in the cup.

We’re excited to present the result: an exceptional nano lot that opens with the aroma of sun melon and orange blossom. A bright and silky mouthfeel reveals layered notes of canary melon, cherries, jasmine, and wild berries. Finishing each sip is an aftertaste of cranberries, adding yet another layer of delightful complexity to your experience.

We recommend this coffee black, brewed as a Pour Over, or using an AeroPress.

Recommended Resting Period: 6 Days

Note: This coffee pack is a special release with limited availability and, therefore, cannot be included in a subscription plan.

products.title: French Press 600 ml
products.body_html: Every home-brewer's go-to equipment, the classic French Press is known to make a consistent, heavy-bodied black coffee. Blue Tokai's French Press features heat-resistant glass and stainless steel body. This equipment can brew up to 4 cups (600ml) of coffee.

products.title: Are You Really Tasting Your Coffee?
products.body_html:
Immerse yourself in the world of specialty coffee with this workshop as you uncover the skills behind evaluating its flavours, mouthfeel, acidity, aromas and aftertaste. Coffee tasting is not just an essential skill for coffee experts; it's a gateway to unlocking a world of sensory experiences.

This coffee tasting workshop is for everyone, whether you're a coffee enthusiast or simply curious about the intricacies of your favourite brew. By understanding the technical aspects of coffee tasting in this workshop, you'll elevate your coffee appreciation to new heights. Moreover, as you fine-tune your palate through this sensory exploration, you'll develop a heightened sense of taste that extends beyond coffee, enhancing your ability to savour and appreciate flavours in everything.

Join us and discover the true essence of specialty coffee and much more!

Workshop Highlights

With this workshop:
- Learn the basics of specialty coffee
- Understand the coffee-tasting Indian Flavour Wheel
- Distinguish between aromas, flavours and tasting notes of different coffees
- Score specialty coffee

Date: 27th September 2025 (Saturday)
Time: 11 AM - 1 PM
Location:

Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters, IC Colony

Blue Tokaic Coffee Roasters, Sumadhura Capitol

Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters, Panchsheel

Please Note: Tickets for this event are non-refundable and cannot be transferred to future events.

products.title: Riverdale Estate N72
products.body_html:
A favourite in our seasonal line-up since 2020, Riverdale Estate - N72 is back! This fruit-forward medium roast is processed using the natural method, with whole coffee cherries dried intact and fermented for 72 hours.

Roasted just past first crack by Sunil on our team, it’s a profile designed to highlight the coffee’s vivid character. You'll first notice an aroma of berries and citrus. Next, a bright, syrupy mouthfeel unfolds into layered notes of pineapple, grapefruit, and dried fig. The aftertaste, zesty and refreshing, rounds off each sip.

We recommend brewing this coffee black, as a Pour Over, or using the AeroPress, to enjoy the full range of flavours this medium roast has to offer.

Recommended Resting Period: 15 Days

products.title: Baarbara Estate
products.body_html:
Coffee beans from Baarbara Estate, roasted medium-dark, have a wonderful aroma of sweet caramel and dried apricot. We love this coffee’s intense, chocolatey flavour profile. To taste the syrupy, smooth mouthfeel of this coffee, we recommend brewing it as a Pour Over, an Espresso or using an AeroPress, Moka Pot or a French Press. If you’ve enjoyed our coffees from Attikan Estate and Sandalwood Estate, you’ll appreciate the sweet aftertaste and medium acidity of this heavy bodied coffee.

Recommended Resting Period: 8 Days

products.title: Warsanlyngdoh Coffee Collective
products.body_html:
It's always exciting for us to partner with a new farm. With Meghalaya's Warsanlyngdoh Coffee Collective, that excitement runs even deeper. A completely new coffee growing region for us, it speaks of the possibilities that the North East Indian soil holds for specialty production. The collective’s origin goes back a decade, when Daman, a first-generation coffee producer, visited Nongryniang—a remote village in Khasi Hills and home to the nanny who cared for him in his early years.

"There, nestled among the misty hills, I came across two old coffee plants growing in someone’s backyard. I later learned that back in the 1980s, the government had briefly launched a coffee planting program in the area. Like many such initiatives, it had long been abandoned and forgotten. But those plants stayed with me. And so did the people.", he recounts. Since then, Daman started a decade-long pursuit of craft and community. From shading systems to post-harvest processing, he spent years learning all it takes to grow high-quality coffee. Over time, the collective has grown in both, resolve and numbers, with 75 farmers now contributing to a harvest. They pick only the ripest cherries by hand, which are sun-dried for 15–22 days depending on weather conditions.

The first coffee that we’ve sourced from the collective is a natural lot we’ve chosen to roast to a medium profile. It brews cups that open with the aroma of raisins, unfolding into a creamy mouthfeel. Notes of blueberry, black tea, and khasi mandarin carry through in each sip, with a long, marmalade-like finish. A balanced coffee, it lends well to various brewing methods, including espresso, Moka Pot, French Press, and AeroPress. It is enjoyable on its own as well as in milk-based beverages.

Recommended Resting Period: 13 Days

products.title: Kuttinkhan Upper Estate
products.body_html:
Our first release from Kuttinkhan Upper Estate, a part of the Kelachandra Group and a Rainforest Alliance certified farm, is here!

A natural lot, this coffee was processed by fermenting whole cherries in an oxygen-free environment, then slow-dried under controlled conditions. Roasted to a medium profile, it crafts vibrant cups with a pleasant acidity and sweetness.

The brew opens with the aroma of red grapes, hinting at the flavour to follow. Soon after, you'll notice notes of red grapes, sweet lime, and cane sugar, wrapped in a syrupy and sweet mouthfeel. Concluding each sip is a chocolatey finish, adding depth to the cup.

Our roasters recommend brewing this coffee as an espresso, AeroPress, French Press and Moka Pot. It tastes great black, and also pairs well with milk.

Recommended Resting Period: 10 Days

products.title: Mooleh Manay Estate – CM Natural
products.body_html:
Returning to our Producer Series after 2023, Komal Sable and Akshay Dashrath share their first experiment with carbonic maceration. Building on the clarity and consistency they achieved with anaerobic fermentation last season, the fifth-generation producers modified their drums to create a CO₂-rich, oxygen-free environment that allows for slower, more controlled fermentation within whole cherries.

The process began by removing floaters to select only ripe, dense cherries, followed by a brief pre-drying phase to reduce surface moisture. The cherries were then sealed in drums, and a custom culture was introduced to extend the fermentation. Over 60 hours, this combination of carbonic maceration and yeast inoculation ensured thorough mucilage breakdown and the development of deep complexity.

Post-fermentation, the cherries were dried on raised beds inside a polyhouse. Continuous raking over 7 to 10 days ensured even drying until a final moisture level of 11–12% was reached.

Roasted light by Rishab from our team, this coffee offers a well-structured cup with notes of fermented red fruit and a bright, juicy sweetness. It opens with the aroma of mixed berries and carries a syrupy mouthfeel, with layered flavours of dried fig, plum, black grape, and mulberry. A chocolatey aftertaste marks the finish, adding further depth.

We recommend brewing this expressive coffee black, as a Pour Over, or using an AeroPress.

Recommended Resting Period: 16 Days

Note: This coffee pack is a special release with limited availability and, therefore, cannot be included in subscription.

products.title: SKIA Coffee (Pack of 2)
products.body_html:
This two-pack (100 gms each) brings together distinct coffees from Nelaji Village in Coorg. Grown by smallholder farmers and processed by Ashish Rao, a first-generation producer, these lots mark our first collaboration with Skia Coffee.

Ripe, high-density cherries were pulped with the mucilage left intact, then placed in sealed tanks for a 72-hour anaerobic fermentation. A yeast strain purpose-built for controlled fermentation was introduced during this stage to develop complexity.

From there, the two lots took separate paths.

Honey Sun Dried

The first lot was dried slowly on raised beds under controlled shade. Roasted to a medium profile, it makes for a balanced cup with notes of sweet lime, prunes, and almond.

Recommended Resting Period: 16 Days

Thermal Shock

This second lot was immersed in hot water, then rapidly cooled in ice. It was then mechanically washed and dried slowly under shade. Also roasted to a medium profile, it brews cups with notes of tangerine, brown sugar, and berries.

Both coffees brew beautifully as an espresso or with an AeroPress, Moka Pot, or French Press. They taste great black and pair well with milk. Together, they offer a chance to explore how thoughtful shifts in processing shape flavour in the final cup.

Recommended Resting Period: 12 Days

Note: This coffee pack is a special release with limited availability and, therefore, cannot be included in subscription.

products.title: Amaltas Blend
products.body_html:
An ode to the vibrant burst of yellow that marks the beginning of Indian summers, this blend is our go-to choice for crafting a refreshing batch of coffee including cold brews. In fact, this was originally called the Cold Bold Blend but owing to its diversity (its flavours shine through in a Pour Over or Aeropress), we decided to rename it after one of our favourite neighbourhood trees.

A blend of washed and natural processed coffees, we’ve roasted it light to accentuate fruity and refreshing citrus notes. The result? Balanced cups with notes of blueberry and milk chocolate, with each sip concluding with a chocolatey finish.

This light and fruity favourite is best enjoyed black.

products.title: Seethargundu Estate
products.body_html:
We’re so excited to launch our first coffee from Harvest ’25! This light roast is from Seethargundu Estate, one of the few Demeter-certified farms in the country. The estate follows biodynamic practices that treat the farm as a living ecosystem, nurturing soil health, biodiversity, and long-term balance.

This washed coffee is clean, fruity and tea-like. It opens with the aroma of brown sugar, leading to a syrupy body with notes of sweet lime, apricot, and black tea. The finish carries that tea-like clarity through to the last sip.

Best brewed as a Pour Over or using the AeroPress, we recommend drinking this coffee black.

Recommended Resting Period: 18 Days
